column1: http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/11/09/obituaries/mitchell-obit.html "A Portfolio of Celebrated Characters" "Jack Mitchell’s photographs captured a history of the arts in the late 20th century."

http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/obituaries/20100329_NOTABLEDEATHS.html "Notable Deaths of 2010" "Remembering George Steinbrenner, J.D. Salinger, Teddy Pendergrass, Howard Zinn and others who died this year."

http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/obituaries/notable-deaths-of-2013.html "Notable Deaths of 2013" "Remembering Jonathan Winters, Julie Harris, Edward I. Koch, Chinua Achebe, Margaret Thatcher, James Gandolfini and others who died this year."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/10/27/obituaries/20131028-REED.html "Lou Reed, 1942-2013" "Mr. Reed, a disciple of Andy Warhol and of the poet Delmore Schwartz, claimed his niche as music’s eternal New York bohemian."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2013/07/20/obituaries/100000002348175/helen-thomas-grills-the-presidents.html "Helen Thomas Grills the Presidents" "Helen Thomas covered every president from John F. Kennedy to Barack Obama and was known for her blunt questions and sharp tone."
http://www.nytimes.com/video/2013/06/19/obituaries/100000002290575/remembering-slim-whitman.html "Remembering Slim Whitman" "Country musician Slim Whitman died Wednesday at age 90."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/03/27/obituaries/20130328-BUCHENWALD.html "Buchenwald’s Liberation, as Seen by Louis Nemeth" "In April 1945, Mr. Nemeth, a U.S. Army Signal Corps photographer, witnessed the horrors of the newly-liberated Buchenwald concentration camp."
http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/02/28/obituaries/20130228_reynolds.html "Bruce Reynolds, 1932-2013" "The mastermind behind the Great Train Robbery died at age 81."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2013/02/01/obituaries/1194834046901/last-word-ed-koch.html "Last Word: Ed Koch" "In an interview conducted in 2007, former Mayor Edward I. Koch reflected on his life and political career, and talked of how he would like to be remembered."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/01/16/obituaries/20130116-KOCH-advobit.html "A Mayor to Remember" "Edward I. Koch served nine years in Congress, but he returned to New York every chance he got. Being away from his beloved city too long, he said, gave him “the bends.” His love affair with the city — often not unrequited — would last a lifetime."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2013/01/16/obituaries/20130301-KOCH.html "A Mayor to Remember" "Edward I. Koch served nine years in Congress, but he returned to New York every chance he got. Being away from his beloved city too long, he said, gave him “the bends.” His love affair with the city — often not unrequited — would last a lifetime."

http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/obituaries/notable-deaths-of-2012.html "Notable Deaths of 2012" "Remembering Etta James, Don Cornelius, Whitney Houston, Anthony Shadid, Adrienne Rich, Dick Clark, Donna Summer, Nora Ephron, Andy Griffith, Gore Vidal and others who died this year."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/12/04/obituaries/20121206_NIEMEYER.html "A Legendary Modernist" "Oscar Niemeyer, the Brazilian architect who created flowing designs, infused Modernism with a new sensuality and inspired of generations of architects worldwide, died Wednesday. He was 104."
http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/11/16/obituaries/20121116LUCAS.html "The Photographs of Cornel Lucas" "Images by the photographer."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/10/17/obituaries/MCGOVERN-OBIT.html "George McGovern Dies at 90" "In a statement, President Obama called Mr. McGovern “a champion for peace” who was a “statesman of great conscience and conviction.”"

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/10/14/obituaries/15specter_ss.html "Arlen Specter, 1930-2012" "The senator from Pennsylvania led the Judiciary Committee through one of its most tumultuous periods, even while battling Hodgkin’s disease in 2005."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/09/30/obituaries/29sulzberger_ss.html "Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, a Times Publisher, Dies" "Mr. Sulzberger shaped the destiny of The New York Times for 34 years as its publisher and as chairman and chief executive of its parent company."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/06/17/obituaries/18king-obit_ss.html "Rodney G. King, Symbol of Police Brutality, Dies at 47" "The acquittal of the police officers accused of beating him during a traffic stop led to six days of rioting in South Los Angeles in 1992."

http://www.nytimes.com/interactive/obituaries/2011_notabledeaths.html "Notable Deaths of 2011" "Remembering Kim Jong-il, Joe Frazier, Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, Steve Jobs, Betty Ford, Peter Falk, Clarence Clemons, Elaine Kaufman, Jack LeLanne, Elizabeth Taylor, Osama bin Laden and others who died this year."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/05/18/obituaries/20120519_RAY.html "A Brazen Kidnapping" "Ed Ray, who was hailed as a hero in 1976 for leading 26 children to safety after they were kidnapped and buried below ground, died on May 17."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/04/18/obituaries/20120419_CLARK_HTML.html "Dick Clark Dies at 82" "Dick Clark, the television host of “American Bandstand,” did much to advance the influence of teenagers and rock ’n’ roll on American culture."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2012/04/08/obituaries/1194826917764/last-word-mike-wallace.html "Last Word: Mike Wallace" "Mike Wallace, the tough-guy interrogator of “60 Minutes,” was the personification of 20th-century television news. He made his name confronting the famous and infamous on camera."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/04/08/obituaries/09wallace-ss.html "Mike Wallace, 1918-2012" "Mike Wallace became one of the nation’s best-known broadcast journalists as an interrogator of the famous and infamous on “60 Minutes.”"

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/02/29/obituaries/eleanor-callahan-photos.html "Harry Callahan’s Portraits of Eleanor Callahan" "Eleanor Callahan, who died Feb. 28 at age 95, was the subject of many of her husband’s most famous photographs, which have been compared to Alfred Stieglitz’s portraits of Georgia O’Keeffe."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2012/02/16/obituaries/20120217_SHADID_HTML.html "Anthony Shadid, Times Correspondent, Dies in Syria" "Anthony Shadid was a Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent who covered nearly two decades of Middle East conflict."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2011/11/26/obituaries/20111126_WICKER.html "Tom Wicker, a Columnist Not Afraid of Controversy" "Tom Wicker, an iconoclastic columnist for The New York Times, became one of postwar America’s most distinguished journalists."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2011/11/05/obituaries/20111106_rooney.html "Andy Rooney: 1919-2011" "Long a mainstay of CBS News, his prickly wit and homespun commentary on “60 Minutes,” made him a household name."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2011/11/02/obituaries/20111102dorothyrodham.html "Dorothy Rodham Dies at 92" "Dorothy Rodham was a powerful influence on the life and career of her daughter, Hillary Rodham Clinton."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2011/07/23/obituaries/20110724-WINEHOUSE.html "Amy Winehouse" "Amy Winehouse, the singer and songwriter who shot to fame with “Rehab,” won five Grammy Awards and sold more than five million albums, has died at age 27."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2011/04/09/obituaries/1194838961597/lwlumet.html "The Last Word: Sidney Lumet" "Sidney Lumet was one of America's most prolific filmmakers. Here he discusses his career, his gritty New York films and his legacy."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2011/03/26/obituaries/1194826919047/lwferraro.html "Last Word: Geraldine A. Ferraro" "In 1984, Geraldine A. Ferraro became the first woman nominated for national office by a major party."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2011/04/18/obituaries/1247464008751/last-word-bob-feller.html "Last Word: Bob Feller" "Bob Feller is one of the greatest baseball pitchers ever to play the game. He began his major league career as a teenager in 1936, throwing a fastball the game has not seen since."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2010/11/14/obituaries/1247464085922/last-word-ted-kheel.html "Last Word: Ted Kheel" "For decades the mediator Ted Kheel was a dominant force in labor disputes.  He developed his unique technique mediating teacher, transit and press strikes."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2010/10/31/obituaries/1247464257079/last-word-theodore-c-sorensen.html "Last Word: Theodore C. Sorensen" "Theodore C. Sorensen was President John F. Kennedy's political strategist, confidant and his favorite speechwriter.  Mr. Sorensen helped craft some of the president's most memorable lines."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2010/10/31/obituaries/1194826919042/the-last-word-theodore-c-sorensen.html "The Last Word: Theodore C. Sorensen" "Theodore C. Sorensen, who died Sunday, was President John F. Kennedy's political strategist, confidant and his favorite speechwriter. Mr. Sorensen helped craft some of the president's most memorable lines.

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2010/04/20/obituaries/1247467659411/an-interview-with-dorothy-height.html "An Interview With Dorothy Height" "In a January interview with The Times's Sheryl Gay Stolberg, Dorothy Height discussed race, her own life and President Obama."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2009/08/13/obituaries/1247463983106/last-word-les-paul.html "Last Word: Les Paul" "Les Paul was a virtuoso guitarist and inventor whose solid-body electric guitar changed the course of 20th-century music."
http://www.nytimes.com/video/2009/08/13/obituaries/1247463982127/last-word-les-paul.html "Last Word: Les Paul" "An excerpt from a video interview with Les Paul, the virtuoso guitarist and inventor."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2009/08/13/obituaries/0813-LESPAUL_index.html "Les Paul Dies at 94" "Mr. Paul was a virtuoso guitarist and inventor whose solid-body electric guitar and recording studio innovations changed the course of 20th-century music."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2009/08/05/obituaries/1194834031638/last-word-budd-schulberg.html "Last Word: Budd Schulberg" "In a Last Word video, Mr. Schulberg reflects on his brief writing partnership with F. Scott Fitzgerald, his disenchantment with the Communist Party and his screenplay for “On the Waterfront.”"

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2008/06/23/obituaries/0623-CARLIN_index.html "George Carlin, 1937-2008" "The Grammy-Award winning standup comedian and actor who was hailed for his irreverent social commentary, died at the age of 71."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2008/06/13/obituaries/1194817098932/the-last-word-stewart-r-mott.html "The Last Word - Stewart R. Mott" "Stewart R. Mott, philanthropist and heir to the General Motors fortune, dedicated his life and money to liberal politics and progressive causes."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2008/06/13/obituaries/1194817477513/the-last-word-stewart-r-mott.html "The Last Word: Stewart R. Mott" "Stewart R. Mott, philanthropist and heir to the General Motors fortune, dedicated his life and money to liberal politics and progressive causes."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2008/06/13/obituaries/1247464105842/the-last-word-stewart-r-mott.html "The Last Word: Stewart R. Mott" "Stewart R. Mott, philanthropist and heir to the General Motors fortune, dedicated his life and money to liberal politics and progressive causes."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2008/04/03/obituaries/1194817116199/frosty-freeze-b-boy.html "Frosty Freeze, B-Boy" "An excerpt from the 1983 documentary ""Style Wars"" featuring the late Wayne Frost, a k a Frosty Freeze, the breakdancing icon."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2008/03/19/obituaries/1194817114251/last-word-dith-pran.html "Last Word: Dith Pran" "New York Times photographer Dith Pran survived the Cambodian killing fields.  He dedicated his life to telling the story of the Khmer Rouge's genocide."

http://www.nytimes.com/slideshow/2008/02/27/obituaries/0227-BUCKLEY_index.html "William F. Buckley Jr., 1925-2008" "Mr. Buckley marshaled polysyllabic exuberance and a refined, perspicacious mind to elevate conservatism to the center of American political discourse."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2007/12/17/obituaries/1194817104229/the-films-of-st-clair-bourne.html "The Films of St. Clair Bourne" "St. Clair Bourne talks about his career as a documentary filmmaker during an interview in June 2006."

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2007/01/18/obituaries/1194817093353/i-just-died.html "Art Buchwald: I Just Died" "Art Buchwald was one of the great American humorists. He delighted in skewering the powerful and the pompous. (Producer: Brent McDonald | Reporter: Tim Weiner)"

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2007/01/18/obituaries/1194817113908/the-herald-tribune-years.html "Art Buchwald: The Herald Tribune Years" "Landing a column at The Herald Tribune took all of the young Buchwald's wit and charm. (Producer: Brent McDonald | Reporter: Tim Weiner)"

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2007/01/18/obituaries/1194817109643/his-political-satire.html "Art Buchwald: His Political Satire" "In 1962, Buchwald gave up his comfortable expat life to chronicle Washington politics. (Producer: Brent McDonald | Reporter: Tim Weiner)"

http://www.nytimes.com/video/2007/01/18/obituaries/1194817116495/a-celebrity-for-death.html "Art Buchwald: A Celebrity for Death" "Buchwald surprised friends and doctors alike as he turned his ""deathbed"" into a lively social circuit. (Producer: Brent McDonald | Reporter: Tim Weiner)"
